mediaGroups.description:
The trip started with heading to Sabba and Safta’s house on Sunday night, where we awaited the ride to the airport.

The flight was originally supposed to be at 1am, but was delayed to 5am.
mediaGroups.title: To Sabba and Safta’s!

mediaGroups.description: We spent some nice time at Sabba and Safta’s house, resting, eating, and repacking things. The driver arrived at around 11:30pm. We loaded our things and went to the airport!
mediaGroups.title: Waiting for the Driver

mediaGroups.description:
At first, the airport driver went to the wrong terminal. It was unusually quiet and we were told that there is a different terminal to go to. Once the driver found it, there was major traffic. We finally got there at 2am, 3 hours before our flight.

The airport was very busy. Apparently there was a Birthright flight scheduled for around the same time and there was limited airport staff at the late hour.

People in the airport seemed especially tense. We had to remember that regardless of where we were in the long lines, we would all get on the same plane at the same time!

Still, it would have been nice if the kids got to sit down, but everyone did great!

Note, the various close-up pictures are courtesy of Moshe who was given a new (old) iPhone shortly before the trip.
mediaGroups.title: Arriving at JFK

mediaGroups.description:
For some of us, this was our first plane ride in 10 years. For others, it was the first plane ride ever.

Some of us were nervous around take-off or landing, while others just sat back and enjoyed whatever was on the screen.

At this point we were all pretty tired and tried to sleep at various times throughout the flight.
mediaGroups.title: The Plane

mediaGroups.description:
And we arrived! Now very tired, but so so happy to be in Israel. It was around 11pm Israel time when we landed, and it took us a couple of hours to go through customs and get our baggage, mostly because kids would stop in awe of various new things - just being in the airport in Israel.

We actually had a small problem when exiting where Shira Ella’s entry card was missing after being handed back to me by somebody in the airport (maybe it fell when I put it back in my bag?). The airport staff wanted us to go back and have her take a new picture, but she was sleeping. Instead, and with some insistence, they called over various people who helped get her a new entry card so we could leave without having to wake her. We appreciated how they balanced the importance of airport security with not waking a sleeping child.
mediaGroups.title: Arrival in Israel

mediaGroups.description:
Our friend Ben came and met us at the airport, apparently waited for us as we took our time exiting the airport, and helped carry our suitcases and helped us to get on the train to the Jerusalem.

Everything was so smooth because of his help, to which we are so grateful for wonderful friends.

We took taxis for the last leg of the journey to the hotel where
mediaGroups.title: Greeted by a Friend

mediaGroups.description:
After a late night, not everyone wanted to get up. We had planned an itinerary that was supposed to include a “rest day” before touring, but forgot to count the “travel day”. Whoops.

Sabba, Safta, and Chaim got up and made it to the hotel breakfast, which was so plentiful and good, and something that we would continue to appreciate every day of this trip.
mediaGroups.title: Breakfast at the Hotel

mediaGroups.description:
We met our tour guide, Shimi, who was referred to us by our cousin Becky, at the hotel. He did an excellent job all around.

Upon leaving the hotel for Ir David, we saw police cars, which Shimi noted was to escort the Prime Minister somewhere, remarking on the irony of how not discreet it is to travel like that. As it turns out, our hotel was a few blocks away from the Prime Minister’s residence in Rechavia.
mediaGroups.title: Leaving the Hotel

mediaGroups.description: We headed to Ir David. While we were here before (10 years ago), we still learned new things about this area and everything that is being excavated. We also went through tunnels that were probably from the time of the Cana’anim.
mediaGroups.title: Ir David

mediaGroups.description: We exited the tunnels at the site of an olive tree that was hundreds of years old. We walked a little further to the kotel.
mediaGroups.title: Olive Tree

mediaGroups.description: Placeholder Description
mediaGroups.title: IMG_1094.HEIC

mediaGroups.description: We stopped at the kotel to pray at the site that Jews have been coming for two thousand years.
mediaGroups.title: The Kotel

mediaGroups.description: We walked through the Jewish Quarter and the Cardo. We eventually exited through the Arab Shuk, where Safta bought something for her friend back in America.
mediaGroups.title: Cardo

mediaGroups.description:
By now, on our first day in Israel, others were well rested enough to get up and do things. Some of us walked around the neighborhood and  found a windmill next to the hotel. Others hung out on Sabba and Safta’s balcony.

We eventually went to a playground down the road. Later, the kids played by the fountain in front of the hotel before going out for dinner at a cafe in Rechavia that Ben had showed Chaim earlier in the day.

We reflected on how amazing it is not only that we have this beautiful land of Israel to be in, but that there are flowers planted everywhere in the streets and parks and cafes and how people take such care of this precious land.
mediaGroups.title: Late Afternoon in Rechavia

mediaGroups.description: And concluding our first day in Israel with a walk to the ice cream place that was near the hotel. All in all a wonderful first full day in Israel!
mediaGroups.title: Ice Cream in Rechavia

mediaGroups.description: We started the day at around 9am with tefilla and a wonderful breakfast. Shimi met us and the tour bus awaited.
mediaGroups.title: Second Day, Our First Trip With All of Us

mediaGroups.description: We traveled west to our first destination, a stalactite cave. Along the way, we saw all of the beautiful hills that surround Jerusalem.
mediaGroups.title: To the Stalactite Cave

mediaGroups.description: We got to the stalactite cave area and walked down some stairs to go down the mountain. There was a small shop before the actual cave and neat to see how easily accessible this thousands-of-years-old wonder is, and yet how well-protected it is at the same time.
mediaGroups.title: Arriving at the Stalactite Cave

mediaGroups.description: We were told to not use flash photography, so some of the pictures are blurry, but it was a surreal experience to see these giant pillars of minerals that had formed over the years into such interesting and awesome shapes.
mediaGroups.title: Stalactites and Stalagmites

mediaGroups.description:
We now went back up the stairs. Sadly, but memorably and ought to be mentioned here, this is when Safta fell. Yair had remarked that some of the steps leading up the mountain were especially smooth, and seemingly Safta stepped on one of them and fell, fracturing her shoulder. To make matters more difficult, this was just moments before Sabba and Safta were about to head off to Mitzpe Ramon to spend two nights there.

Safta resolved to continue up the steps and to still go to Mitzpe Ramon and take it moment by moment, instead of focussing on the hurt shoulder. There was a taxi next to the tour bus awaiting to take them there, and so we all walked up together and Sabba and Safta went to their taxi and we to our tour bus.
mediaGroups.title: Back to the Tour Bus

mediaGroups.description: Sabba and Safta headed off for two nights in Mitzpe Ramon. This was to be their “vacation within the vacation”. They booked two nights at the Beresheet Hotel to spend time in the South, by the Ramon Crater. Picture from that are below, but for the rest of us, the tour continued on!
mediaGroups.title: IMG_0348.HEIC

mediaGroups.description:
The next stop was the bat cave. This involved a hike up another mountain that was a short bus ride away. This time there were no steps or gift shops along the way. And it was getting very hot.

Everybody did amazing on the ~3km hike to the cave. There were some slippery rock to climb up, but kids of all ages managed with only a little help at times.

We stopped at almost every shady spot along the way, and there were beautiful trees all around, including olive and (possibly) carob trees.
mediaGroups.title: To the Bat Cave

mediaGroups.description:
We got to the actual bat cave. Now, not everybody wanted to go in. Shimi the tour guide went ahead with Moshe and Nuriya. Chaim went in with Eshka, although every time it seemed like a bat was coming to us, Eshka screamed and we ran out together. Rifka, Yair, and Shira hung out outside the bat cave.

As Eshka and Chaim inched our way further and further in, and tried talking calmly to the bats (which they seemed responsive too), they noticed that Moshe and Nuriya went with Shimi all the way to the end of the cave (at least where people can walk)! They slowly went forward and eventually met up with them as they were on their way back.

Soon after that, a large group of yeshiva kids came in with flashlights. It suddenly was not as scary, although Chaim pondered if the bats were now more scared of us. We learned that the batcave is only open the public during certain months to give the bats a break.

Most of these pictures are blurry as it was very dark in the bat cave.
mediaGroups.title: Into the Bat Cave

mediaGroups.description: Just outside of the bat cave, there is a natural formation in the rock that happens to make for a natural slide.
mediaGroups.title: The Rock Slide

mediaGroups.description: We hiked back, this time carefully going down the mountain to make our way back to the bus for the next activity on the schedule.
mediaGroups.title: Back to the Tour Bus Again

mediaGroups.description: The next stop was Shimi’s home to pick up some watermelon and then visit a wellspring that is nearby.
mediaGroups.title: And to the Wellspring

mediaGroups.description: Chaim is getting acclimated to the water. Nuriya went in to. And, by the way, the watermelon was amazing.
mediaGroups.title: The Wellspring

mediaGroups.description: This was just our second day in Israel and some of us still adjusting to the jet lag in different ways, as well as doing so many new things, but we had one more thing on today’s schedule - to go to the Museum of Biblical Natural History. These are pictures of the way there.
mediaGroups.title: Next stop: The Museum of Biblical Natural History

mediaGroups.description: Every animal at this museum is mentioned somewhere in the Tanach. Not all animals were alive.
mediaGroups.title: The Museum of Biblical Natural History

mediaGroups.description: We told the Weinstocks that we would be at the museum and so Rob and Ayelet met us there. Eshka has not seen Ayelet in almost a year since they moved to Israel, so this was a special reunion in the midst of amazing animals and such
mediaGroups.title: Friends Visit

mediaGroups.description: We were able to pet and hold the animals (carefully), which included the snakes!
mediaGroups.title: Petting and Holding the Animals

mediaGroups.description: On the way out, we noticed that the gift shop sells kosher locusts with an amusing sign.
mediaGroups.title: Locusts in the Gift Shop

mediaGroups.description: After a day of adventure, we arrived back at the hotel at around 5:45pm for a quick recharge.
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaEvents.title: Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum

mediaGroups.description: Moshe, Eshka, and Abba ventured out to Ben Yehuda Street at around 6:40pm. They stopped on the way there at a grocery store to get Israeli Kinder Eggs and chocolate to bring back.
mediaGroups.title: Recharged and Ready to Explore

mediaGroups.description: They stopped at “King of Fries”
mediaGroups.title: King of Fries

mediaGroups.description: And then Pizza Hut. Being able to eat almost anywhere or even eating in a restaurant (fast food) place was a new and exciting experience for everybody. While we have several kosher amenities back in West Hartford, there is something amazing about being able to walk into a Pizza Hut and order a kosher slice of pizza.
mediaGroups.title: Pizza Hut

mediaGroups.description: The streets are filled with beautiful decorations.
mediaGroups.title: Walking Back

mediaGroups.description:
Later that night, after the kids went to sleep, Chaim took a walk to the Old City to visit the kotel again and daven maariv. On the way back, he stopped by the menorah outside the Hurva shul in the Jewish Quarter and took some selfies next to it and a cat.

Some fascinating info about the golden menorah can be found here: https://templeinstitute.org/history-holy-temple-menorah/

Chaim took a bus back, so he could figure out how to use buses in Jerusalem to be prepared for the next day’s adventure. He got on a bus, but did not have a Rav Kav card and was unable to setup the Moovit app, but the driver literally just gave him a Rav Kav card with money already on it. He tried to refuse, but the driver insisted.
mediaGroups.title: Chaim in the Old City

mediaGroups.description:
The following pictures are from Sabba and Safta’s visit to Miztpe Ramon. Safta said about her hurt shoulder that there is nothing that she can do about it, so she might as well just appreciate every moment of being in this beautiful place.

It also happened that Sabba left his camera in the taxi (which we got back the following week), so there are not many pictures. But, here they are, starting with, apparently, a picture of a McDonalds that was on the way there?
mediaGroups.title: Sabba and Safta in Mitzpe Ramon

mediaGroups.description:
For the rest of the crew, it was a new morning in Jerusalem and we had a late start with no official tours scheduled. Instead, the plan for the day was to find the famous “Monster Slide” that we vaguely remember going to 10 years ago, although possibly confused with a video of watching Jason and Jen at that very slide back in 1978.

The early afternoon started with running into a friend on the street!
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile…

mediaGroups.description: Some excitement about taking a city bus in Jerusalem
mediaGroups.title: Bus ride to the slide

mediaGroups.description:
And here we are at the Monster Slide. As noted above, this was the same slide that Sabba and Safta went to with Jason and Jenn, back in 1978. In fact, here is a link to a video of that, in the part that shows them there: https://youtu.be/GgLQchcvP7M?t=1192

While Sabba and Safta were in Mitzpe Ramon this time around, and missed this visit to the Monster Slide, it seems like that at least experienced it back in 1978.
mediaGroups.title: The Monster Slide

mediaGroups.description:
Next, we went to Ben Yehuda Street for lunch. Yair wanted to stay back to the hotel, so we dropped him off, since we inadvertently ended up taking a bus stop that was adjacent to the hotel anyway. After that, Chaim wanted to lead everyone else on a trip through the Mamilla Mall and to the Kotel, stopping for food along the way.

Unfortunately, Chaim was still getting his sense of direction in Jerusalem and didn’t look at Google Maps, so we ended up walking in circles, but was really nice passing by everything that was going on. Eventually the kids were hungry, so we stopped at Pasta Basta and brought lunch back for Yair.
mediaGroups.title: Pasta Basta

mediaGroups.description: Towards the end of a less trip-focused, more grounded third day in Jerusalem, some decided to stay in and enjoy the Kinder Eggs from the previous evening.
mediaGroups.title: Staying In

mediaGroups.description: Moshe however decided that he wants to work on his Scratch project, to which Abba said that he should do it in some public internet place that is “out”. And so Abba and Moshe ventured to Ben Yehuda to find public internet. They stopped at Big Apple Pizza and ate, but alas no internet there. So, they found a spot outside on the busy streets.
mediaGroups.title: Venturing Out

mediaGroups.description: Moshe enjoyed climbing on the various things along the streets. Wherever we would walk, he found find ledges and such to walk along.
mediaGroups.title: Climbing

mediaGroups.description: After the kids were settled, Chaim went back out to go daven Ma’ariv at the kotel again. And again he got a little lost, but this time built up his mental map of Jerusalem and where different streets lead and converge. And so, on the way there, he past by the Montefiore Windmill, which is technically not on the way.
mediaGroups.title: Chaim’s Second Night Roam

mediaGroups.description: Upon reaching the kotel at 12:45am, there was a large group singing and dancing. Chaim spent some time there and then went back to the hotel to rest up for the next day of activity and Erev Shabbat in Jerusalem.
mediaGroups.title: The Kotel at 12:45am

mediaGroups.description: The day started with another wonderful breakfast and then Abba and Shira went to the playground.
mediaGroups.title: Friday Morning in Jerusalem

mediaGroups.description: After everybody got ready, we ventured out to the Botanical Gardens in Jerusalem. We walked there and had some trouble finding the entrance with a stroller, due to some nearby construction, but once we found it, the kids stopped to rest.
mediaGroups.title: To the Botanical Gardens

mediaGroups.description: Before actually going into the garden, we stopped for lunch at a nearby cafe, noting that things were closing early for Shabbat and that the kids were getting hungry.
mediaGroups.title: Quick Stop for Lunch

mediaGroups.description: They stopped at Terem to look at Safta’s shoulder. It turned out it was fractured after an x-ray. They gave Safta a sling and some instructions to come back in a week.
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile, Sabba and Safta were Arriving Back in Jerusalem

mediaGroups.description: We were now ready to enter the garden, but first stopping to look at the lily pads and a frog.
mediaGroups.title: The Lily Pads

mediaGroups.description: Ok, to the garden.
mediaGroups.title: The Garden

mediaGroups.description: The kids did bowling with a pine cone.
mediaGroups.title: Pine Cone Bowling

mediaGroups.description: We took the bus back to the hotel, since everyone was tired and Abba did not want to push the stroller up hill.
mediaGroups.title: Taking the Bus Back

mediaGroups.description: We took a break at the fountain outside the hotel before going in.
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaGroups.description:
We arrived back to get ready for Shabbat and were greeted by Sabba and Safta who were getting ready as well.

We do not have pictures of course, but Shabbat in the hotel with all of us together was such a wonderful experience. The food was really good, but it just felt so special to be in Jerusalem together around the table making kiddush and in room with so many families and groups doing the same.

On Friday night after the meal, some of us walked to the Old City to try to visit Binyonim Sheis and then to the kotel. We could not find where Binyonim was staying, but proceeded on to the kotel, which was the first time for Nuriya and Shira, and the first time this visit for Rifka, Eshka, and Moshe.

As we learned, the Old City is not easy to get around with a stroller, but some yeshiva bachorim helped with at least one set of stairs.

We had a wonderful Friday night at the kotel.

Afterwards, Chaim went to visit Ben at Sora’s apartment and they played games up 4:30am.

The next morning, some of us slept in a little, still getting over jet lag and catching up on sleep, but we all eventually made it to daven at our various paces and then to do kiddush at around 2pm. Again, the food was wonderful and so great being all together.

Later in the afternoon, Chaim, Rifka, and Eshka headed off to visit the Rothman’s in Nachlaot. They went up the seven flights of stairs to their apartment and hung out with them on the room of their building eating watermelon and having meaningful conversation.

Afterwards, some of us went to visit Ben to play games, and by the end of Shabbat, Chaim, Rifka, Yair, Moshe, and Eshka were all at Sora’s apartment hanging out, and we made havdallah there, led by Sora’s father, while Sabba, Safta, Nuriya, and Shira hung out at the hotel.
mediaGroups.title: Sabba and Safta are Back and Shabbat is Coming

mediaGroups.description: Happening in the backdrop of our trip to Israel were protests about the Judicial Reform. Being that our hotel was in Rechavia, just a couple blocks away from the Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s residence, and being at a major intersection, it was apparently also a hot spot for political activism. As such, there were protests on the street right outside the hotel, near the fountain. And so was the start of our second week in Israel.
mediaGroups.title: Protests

mediaGroups.description: Sabba and Safta get an early start and then venture out to the Jerusale Great Synagogue, which was right next to the hotel.
mediaGroups.title: Sunday Morning

mediaEvents.title: Sabba and Safta Visit Jerusalem Great Synagogue

mediaGroups.description: It was Sunday morning. We had a few options on the schedule for today, and Rifka and Chaim decided that we would walk to First Station, where they would surprise Yair for his birthday. Not pictured here is Rifka and Chaim’s walk to a bakery to obtain that cake, as well as a blue hat for Safta.
mediaGroups.title: Yom Rishon

mediaGroups.description: We stopped at the Montefiore Windmill on the way, as well as a Shalhevet Etsioni, where Shira found an interesting snail shell and we listened to a recording about the memorial.
mediaGroups.title: IMG_0541.JPG

mediaGroups.description: We then stopped at the Lion fountain, and some of us went in it.
mediaGroups.title: The Lion Fountain

mediaGroups.description:
And then we went to First Station. We were here 10 years ago (not all of us), and there seemed to be more things. For example, there was an old train car that Yair and Moshe (and possibly Eshka) played around 10 years ago. That was upgraded and now you can go in it and there is a whole miniature city connected by train tracks and model trains in it. There also seemed to be some new (well not new, but newly placed) amusement rides. We had burgers and (surprise!) birthday cake, and the kids went on various rides. We also shopped in the little gift shops and there were some interestingly translated items.

We also went to two places that we remember from 10 years ago that were still there: The puzzle store, where we purchased some wooden puzzles, and Rebar, the juice bar.
mediaGroups.title: First Station

mediaGroups.description: After coming back from First Station, some of the kids checked out their new puzzles in the lobby, for quick recharge before heading back out to Gan Sacher.
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaGroups.description: Placeholder Description
mediaGroups.title: Placeholder Title

mediaGroups.description: After a short regrouping back at the hotel, the next stop was Gan Sacher. Rifka made plans to meet Aliza and her children, of who we remember from 10 years ago when we stayed in Katamon and the kids used to climb through the windows into their adjoining apartment.  Eshka was not feeling great, so she went with Rifka in a taxi, while others walked through Rechavia and to the park.
mediaGroups.title: Going to Gan Sacher

mediaGroups.description: This was the biggest playground we had ever seen.
mediaGroups.title: The Playground

mediaGroups.description: Here we are with Aliza and her children. We also met up with Abby and her family, which was a wonderful surprise that the timing could work out. We do not seem to have any pictures of that reunion though.
mediaGroups.title: Aliza and Children

mediaEvents.title: Gan Sacher, Meet Abby Family and Aliza and Family

mediaGroups.description: Special for Yair's birthday, after Gan Sacher, Ben met us to take Yair to a game store in Ben Yehuda Street area. Unfortunately the store that he had in mind was not open, but Yair was able to look around at a book store that also had games.
mediaGroups.title: A bookstore with games

mediaGroups.description: After checking out games, Ben, Chaim, and Yair stopped at the hotel and picked up Sabba and Moshe and we headed to the movies!  This would be Chaim's second time going to the movies in Israel - the first about 20 years ago to watch Spiderman 2. And here we saw Across the Spiderverse.  This would be second or even third viewing for some of us, but this spectacular movie was only made better by the fact that we were in Jerusalem experiencing it. It was a special evening indeed.
mediaGroups.title: Across the Spiderverse

mediaGroups.description: After a late night at the movies, we got up early and Shimi met us for our next adventure - to head in the direction of Tel Aviv.  Shimi scheduled with the Galita Cholocate Factory, and so that was our first stop.  Pictured here was a picture that we took on the bus, while we were all a little tired, but to send to our cousin Judy Porat, whom we were making plans with for another day.
mediaGroups.title: On the bus early for our next adventure

mediaGroups.description: Some of us were especially tired from the late night before.
mediaGroups.title: At the Chocolate Factory!

mediaGroups.description: We all made some really nice works of art. These pictures tried to capture that, because they did melt on the bus shortly after. But, we still enjoyed eating them, even though there was a lot of leftover chocolate.
mediaGroups.title: Chocolate Art

mediaGroups.description: After the Galita Chocolate Factory, we went to Tel Aviv, to the Anu Museum
mediaGroups.title: To the Anu Museum

mediaGroups.description: The Anu Museum is on the campus of Tel Aviv University. While there, the kids found a tree that is apparently common in Israel. They took with them some of the large "beans" that grow from it, that look almost like a large carob. These would later end up in one of our suitcases, which would end up not coming back with us from Israel, probably due to the "sword-like beans" in it.
mediaGroups.title: Tel Aviv University

mediaGroups.description: The museum had some really powerful exhibits that took us through the incredible diversity of Jewish life of today and much of our history, and yet everything was also very fun and accessible for all ages. Great museum!
mediaGroups.title: The Anu Museum

mediaGroups.description: Next we went to the beach, where we met our cousins Marla and Becky Arbiv.  Shimi, our tour guide, was recommended to us as a friend of Becky, whom Chaim had only met virtually months before our trip and learned that she is in the same industry - biotechnology - and actually has had meetings with his company - 10X Genomics. Of course, we arranged to meet when in Israel and it worked out that Becky's mother, Marla - that is Sabba's niece, was there at the same time.
mediaGroups.title: Cousins Reunion

mediaGroups.description: Our next step for some would be the Weinstock’s (Natalie’s) parents house where they were staying. Sabba, Safta, and Yair decided to go back to the hotel and the tour bus took them the rest of the way. The rest of us hung out with the Weinstock's and the kids watched a movie outside, while the adults talked and had hotdogs. It was particularly grounding after such a packed day of so much wonderful activity.
mediaGroups.title: Weinstock's Hangout

mediaEvents.title: Galita Chololate Factory, Anu Museum, Tel Aviv Beach with Cousins, and Hanging out with the Weinstocks

mediaGroups.description: This was to be last of our major travel/touring days for this visit to Israel, and would involve the most time/distance spent going places. It was a very hot day and we headed along the Jordon River to go North towards Afula. Shimi met us in the morning and we boarded the bus and were on our way!
mediaGroups.title: Into the Desert

mediaGroups.description: While sitting on the bus, Nuriya wondered aloud “Will we ride on camels?” What good timing to ask, as Shimi told the driver to please pull over at the next place where there are camels and that happened to be very shortly up the road.  While Nuriya did not actually go on a camel, Moshe, Eshka, and Rifka did.  Rifka also got a necklace, as a gift from Sabba and Safta.
mediaGroups.title: Camels

mediaGroups.description: We continued through the desert with Shimi talking about the places that we passed. We had a quick stop at a cafe (and tefillin for those had not yet!) and then to our next stop - Gan Garoo Zoo.
mediaGroups.title: Quick Stop Before Gan Garoo Zoo

mediaGroups.description: It was very hot and everyone was feeling it, but we were still excited to be at the zoo and to see some really interesting animals. Apparently this zoo has animals that are from Austraila.
mediaGroups.title: Gan Garoo

mediaGroups.description: One of the world's most dangerous and most interesting birds.
mediaGroups.title: The Cassowary

mediaGroups.description: We were able to literally just walk among the kangaroos and pet and feed them. They seemed to be very well fed and were docile with us.
mediaGroups.title: Petting Kangaroos

mediaGroups.description: After the Gan Ganroo Zoo, we went to Gan HaShalosha, a body of water that is on the side of a mountain.  Chaim and Rifka went in the water and eventually Eshka did too.
mediaGroups.title: Gan HaShalosha

mediaGroups.description: Our next stop would be Tiveria/Tiberius, to the Kineret. But, stopping for a late lunch on the way.
mediaGroups.title: To Tiveria!

mediaGroups.description: The original plan was to go on a boat ride on the Kineret. On the way there, Moshe saw a giant water slide and asked if we could do that instead. Shimi, ever resourceful, made a quick call and we ended up going to the water park!  Yair, Safta, and Shimi did not go and ended up hanging out nearby, but the rest of us went to the water park and went on various water slides by the Kineret.
mediaGroups.title: Water Park

mediaGroups.description: We stopped on the way back to Jerusalem. Pictured here, more camels.
mediaGroups.title: Stop On the Way Back

mediaEvents.title: Camel Rides, Gan Ganroo, Gan HaShalosha, and Kineret Water Park

mediaGroups.description: Later that evening, Rifka and Chaim ventured out to Ben Yehuda area.
mediaGroups.title: Date Night

mediaGroups.description: We found a bar in Ben Yehuda area that had live American music and a Playstation where we played Mortal Kombat
mediaGroups.title: Blaze Rock Bar

mediaGroups.description: For the rest of the trip, we did not have any more planned tours, but did have a number of things that we wanted to see or do. One such thing, at least for some of us, was to go to the Dead Sea.  And so we started planning that the next morning, but first Tefilla!  In this picture, Shira joined Chaim in the hotel's synagouge. Afterwards, we would make plans and some of us would go to the Dead Sea.
mediaGroups.title: Wednesday Morning

mediaGroups.description: When we told Moshe that there is a Pizza Hut in the bus station, he decided to come with us to the Dead Sea, which he was otherwise seemingly ambivelent about.  The novelty of kosher pizza was greater than the novelty of a wonder of the world.
mediaGroups.title: Stop at Pizza Hut

mediaGroups.description: The bus dropped us off in what was basically "the middle of the desert", really a short walk from the actual beach, but if not for the signs, it would look like there was desert hills all around. Eventually, somebody in a shuttle came and picked us up, but would have probably been about a 15 minute walk otherwise.
mediaGroups.title: To Kalia Beach

mediaGroups.description: After our Dead Sea experience, we awaited the bus back to Jerusalem. Again, it was an interesting feeling with desert all around.
mediaGroups.title: Awaiting the Bus Back

mediaGroups.description: Moshe got this camel for Shira at the gift shop by the Dead Sea. He would later notice that this same (or similar) camel is sold in many other places. But, this one was special.
mediaGroups.title: Camel

mediaGroups.description: While Sabba, Chaim, and Moshe were at the Dead Sea, others hung out in Jerusalem.
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile in Jerusalem

mediaGroups.description: Yair got to play Race to the Galaxy with Ben in the hotel lobby
mediaGroups.title: Race to the Galaxy with Ben

mediaGroups.description: Rifka took Yair to the Kotel.
mediaGroups.title: Kotel with Rifka and Yair

mediaGroups.description: While Rifka and Yair were in the Old City, Sabba, Chaim, and Moshe got back from the Dead Sea. Later, Sabba and Safta went out for dinner, and Chaim decided to bring Nuriya and Shira to meet them there.  The next several pictures are in chronological order, but of two separate events in different parts of Jerusalem.
mediaGroups.title: Meeting Sabba and Safta in Ben Yehuda

mediaGroups.description: Chaim checked again to see if the game store was open to then tell Rifka and Yair to meet there. It was not open.
mediaGroups.title: Game Store Closed Again

mediaEvents.title: Meanwhile in Jerusalem, Dinner in Ben Yehuda, and the Game Store is Closed

mediaGroups.description: Later on Wednesday night, there was a big protest outside the hotel. Here are some of the pictures of it.
mediaGroups.title: Protests Against Judicial Reform

mediaGroups.description: It was the morning of the 17th of Tammuz, a fast day.  We were trying to decide what we should do today that would be meaningful, and discussing if it would be wise to do anything, since it was very hot and easy to get dehydrated. After some deliberation (and I think a walk to drop of our laundry, if I remember correctly), we decided to go to First Station again.
mediaGroups.title: 17 Tammuz

mediaGroups.description: We went back to the puzzle store at First Station that we went to 10 years ago. The kids picked out puzzles, including a tanagrams set, and played them outside. Shira slept in the stroller.
mediaGroups.title: Puzzle Store

mediaGroups.description: Chaim wanted to go to the Old City for the remainder of the fast day, already starting to feel dehydrated, but just wanted to settle somewhere in the Old City by the Kotel.  On the way there, Chaim found a small section of Jerusalem called Mishkenot She'enim, where there was a plaque that talked about Avraham Michael Kirshenbaum, who "stood alone defending Yemin Moshe against the enemy". Chaim found this area, just outside the Old City, to be particularly special and meaningful on 17 Tammuz, reflecting on everything that came before to be able to stand in this spot today, and spent some time there before heading to the Old City, walking through Yemin Moshe.
mediaGroups.title: Mishkenot She'enim

mediaGroups.description: On the way to the Old City, Chaim passed the Artist Colony and nearby ceramic art studio, where he and Rifka would go on a date a couple days later.
mediaGroups.title: Artist Colony

mediaGroups.description: Some of the kids who were not fasting, stayed at First Station and ate.
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile, at First Station

mediaGroups.description: Chaim walked around the Old City before getting to the Kotel. He was getting to be more and more thirsty, but still stopped to look at all of the layers that the Old City was built upon.
mediaGroups.title: Chaim at the Old City

mediaGroups.description: It was getting late in the day and some people at the Kotel were starting to daven maariv, while others were putting on tefillin.
mediaGroups.title: Kotel

mediaGroups.description: In the meantime, Sabba and Safta went to Terem for Safta's arm to get checked out. B"H, she was told it was healing well and might start to feel better in "3 weeks". Of course 17 Tammuz is the start of "three weeks".
mediaGroups.title: Terem

mediaGroups.description: By now, Chaim was feeling very tired, but still got to be part of a very moving mincha service in the Kotel arch tunnel area.  After that, Chaim took a taxi back and arrived back just before the end of the fast.
mediaGroups.title: End of the Fast Day

mediaEvents.title: 17 Tammuz, First Station, and Around Old City and Kotel

mediaGroups.description: It was a new day and we had made plans to visit our cousins the Sylveski's at a pizza place in Emek Refaim
mediaGroups.title: Friday Morning Breakfast

mediaGroups.description: But first, Rifka and Chaim went to get ice cream at the nearby Katsefet
mediaGroups.title: Ice Cream

mediaGroups.description: On the way to the pizza place, Chaim needed to stop at a SuperPharm to pick something up for his stomach, which was not feeling great. When there, he got to do a special mitzvah to help somebody. It was especially nice to be at the right place at the right time, something that was particularly palpable throughout our time in Israel.
mediaGroups.title: To Emek Refaim

mediaGroups.description: Yair got Sushi from a nearby place
mediaGroups.title: Sushi

mediaGroups.description: We all got to hang out with Elaine and Teddy Sylvesky
mediaGroups.title: The Sylvesky's

mediaGroups.description: It was nearly Shabbat, but we needed to pick up the laundry.
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaGroups.description: The laundry place was closed. Yair would end up taking a special trip with Sabba to pick up a new Shabbat shirt at the one store that they could find that was still open.
mediaGroups.title: No Laundry

mediaGroups.description: We found a particularly interesting brand of kosher wine. Of course, there are no pictures from Shabbat, but we had guests: The Weinstock family came to share Shabbat meals with us in the hotel, staying at a nearby hotel, and so did Ben.  We had a very lively and wonderful Shabbat meal. There was so much joy of us all being together, and so much interesting discussion.  On Shabbat day, Chaim still had an upset stomache from the day before, and so he stayed in the hotel for much of the day, but still had really nice get-togethers. Others went to a playground. And others played games.  Near the end of Shabbat, Chaim was starting to feel better, and there were really nice interactions with all of the kids and families and friends.
mediaGroups.title: Shabbat Preparation

mediaGroups.description: The kids wanted to play card games with Ben. I said, let's go to the Rova - in the Old City - and play games there. And so we headed out, stopping in Ben Yehuda area, and eventually taking a taxi to the Old City.
mediaGroups.title: Motzei Shabbat

mediaGroups.description: While we were going to the Old City, Sabba and Safta captured more protests happening outside the hotel, as was apparently the normal Motzei Shabbat activity during that political climate.
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile, More Protests Outside the Hotel

mediaGroups.description: We talked about how so much had happened through history such that we can safely sit in the Jewish Quarter, eating french fries, and playing games on a motzei Shabbat.
mediaGroups.title: The Rova

mediaGroups.description: Moshe had, what he understood to be, the longest french fry ever.
mediaGroups.title: The Longest French Fry

mediaGroups.description: On our way back, the kids explored some of the ancient structures that were all around, before leaving through the more modern structures of the Mamila Mall
mediaGroups.title: Heading Back

mediaGroups.description: After some hours, we ended up back at the hotel, where the kids and Chaim played Race to the Galaxy with Ben.
mediaGroups.title: The Hotel Lobby

mediaEvents.title: Motzei Shabbat Games in the Rova and Beyond

mediaGroups.description: It was Sunday morning, a new week, and we came down for the hotel breakfast as we did every day. This would be our last few days of this trip to Israel. Still with some things that we had on our list to see and do, we put together a plan for the day's adventures.  It would be to (finally) take Yair to the Game Store where he can pick out some games for his birthday, go to the Shuk with Sabba and Safta, and visit the Noimans in Gilo
mediaGroups.title: A New Week

mediaGroups.description: So many choices, and so nice to see so many games in Hebrew. Yair picked out some English games, and Chaim picked out one Hebrew game.  We would later meet at this store again with Rifka, Nuriya and Shira, and they would pick out additional games.
mediaGroups.title: At the Game Store

mediaGroups.description: We then went to a Sushi place.
mediaGroups.title: Sushi

mediaGroups.description: Chaim was feeling particularly concerned about timing of everything and so we made haste to get to the Shuk, where we would meet Sabba, Safta, Eshka, and Moshe. There was a lot of coordination to get everybody to meet at the same time and place, but B"H, it all worked.
mediaGroups.title: Time to Go to the Shuk

mediaGroups.description: Before heading out to the Noiman's, we stopped back at the hotel to find that the beds were made and they even placed the kid's stuffed animals nicely on the pillows.
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaGroups.description: Sabba and Safta stayed at the hotel, while the rest of us took a taxi to Gilo and went to the Noiman's. It was so nice to get to sit with our old neighbors in Israel.
mediaGroups.title: The Noiman's

mediaEvents.title: Game Store, Shuk, and Visiting Noimans in Gilo

mediaGroups.description: Rifka and Chaim snuck out of the hotel to go on a date, unbeknownst that Sabba and Safta were also out at that time.  They first went to look for a certain Chabad shul to daven mincha, and when they could not find it, ended up going to what they thought was a Breslov shul, but turned out to be next to a Breslov shul.  With the timing of everything, they headed to Ben Yehuda next, only to bump into Sabba and Safta who were also walking around that area.
mediaGroups.title: Rifka and Chaim Venture Out

mediaEvents.title: Second Date Night and Bump into Sabba and Safta Who Are Also Out

mediaGroups.description: It was the second-to-last day of this trip and we had a relaxing morning in the hotel. Rifka and Chaim would eventually head out for a third date on this trip! And then a visit to our cousins, the Porats in Beerot Yitzchak.
mediaGroups.title: Monday Morning

mediaGroups.description: Rifka and Chaim went to Mishkenot She'enim, followed by the ceramic art place, the places that Chaim went to on 17 Tammuz
mediaGroups.title: Mishkenot She'enim Again

mediaGroups.description: Rifka made the Kineret and Chaim made a lion
mediaGroups.title: The Kineret and a Lion

mediaGroups.description: Rifka and Chaim have fast food on Jaffa Street. It turns out that there are (at least) two "King of Fries"
mediaGroups.title: King of Fries and Shnitzel

mediaGroups.description: Rifka and Chaim ran back to drop off their art and head out with the family to visit the Porats in Beerot Yitzchak
mediaGroups.title: Running Back

mediaGroups.description: We went to the central bus station and got on the bus to Petach Tikva. Unlike when heading north along the East side of Israel, which is mostly desert, the landscape to the West was very green and with much scenic forest all around.  Our cousins would meet us at the Kibbutz.
mediaGroups.title: Bus to Petach Tikvah

mediaGroups.description: Settling in at the Porat's before taking a tour of the kibbutz.
mediaGroups.title: Tiras Cham

mediaGroups.description: This was probably supposed to be a picture of parakeets that were all over these trees.
mediaGroups.title: Parakeets

mediaGroups.description: Chaim rememebered all of the interesting cacti that were all around the kibbutz from when he was there about 20 years prior.
mediaGroups.title: Cacti

mediaGroups.description: We stopped to check out the synagouge and the playground outside it.
mediaGroups.title: The synagouge

mediaGroups.description: Next up was cows, more playgrounds, and tractors.
mediaGroups.title: Kibbutz Tour

mediaGroups.description: The kids made themselves at home.
mediaGroups.title: At the Porat's

mediaGroups.description: Binyomin Sheis and his son made a special trip to meet us for dinner.  It was such a nice experience to get to sit with our cousins and an old friend together.
mediaGroups.title: A special guest

mediaGroups.description: Our cousins gave us rides back to the bus stop and we headed back to the Jerusalem for our last night of this trip.
mediaGroups.title: Leaving the Kibbutz

mediaGroups.description: Placeholder Description
mediaGroups.title: Back at the Hotel

mediaEvents.title: Beerot Yitzchak, Visit Porats, and Binyomon Sheis Stops By

mediaGroups.description: We got back late from the Kibbutz, but that did not stop Chaim from wanting to visit the Kotel again. He contacted Ben who was on his way back from training in martial arts, and they met up and headed to the Kotel.
mediaGroups.title: To the Kotel.

mediaGroups.description: We arrived just in time for a minyan to recite Nishmat Kol Chai
mediaGroups.title: Nishmat Kol Chai

mediaGroups.description: Chaim and Ben sat in the tunnel where people spend the night learning, and discussed this post from Rabbi Shmuli Phillips: https://www.facebook.com/groups/JudaismReclaimed/permalink/3600363990192751/
mediaGroups.title: Kotel Tunnel

mediaGroups.description: Standing in this kotel tunnel and reflecting on how there are layers upon layers of history of Jewish lives and societies that were all here at some point.  It is hard to tell from the picture, but it is long way down beneath that glass.
mediaGroups.title: Tunnels beneath the tunnel

mediaEvents.title: Night Visit to the Kotel with Ben Skoler

mediaGroups.description: Tefilla, Breakfast, and Yair working on a game in the hotel lobby.  We are so comfortable here and sad to be leaving, but there is much packing to do, so after an early start, we pack!
mediaGroups.title: Last Morning of the trip

mediaEvents.title: Last Morning of the Trip, Yair Works on Game in Lobby

mediaGroups.description: By around noon, we had finished packing and everything was in the lobby. Our flight was in about 12 hours. Although, we were told that we need to get to the airport extra early because there were expected protests that could block traffic.  Still, we had about 6 more hours in Jerusalem, so...
mediaGroups.title: Packed

mediaGroups.description: Rifka and Chaim went to La Piedra, the pizza place across from the hotel that everybody had been telling us to go to.
mediaGroups.title: La Piedra

mediaGroups.description: Sabba, Safta, Chaim, Moshe, and Eshka went to visit the kotel, while Rifka, Nuria, and Shira went to the Tisch Biblical Zoo, and Yair stayed at the hotel to work on his game and eventually meet Ben to play games in the lobby.  It is amazing how after just two weeks, we all felt so comfortable to just do different things, mere hours before we would need to be heading to the airport.
mediaGroups.title: Another visit to the Kotel

mediaGroups.description: We took a taxi to the Jewish Quarter, although he didn't take us directly to the Kotel (in retrospect, it would have been good to be more specific). Safta's shoulder was still in a sling and she was trying to regain balance, which makes it particularly ironic that we ended up walking along a narrow path with steep steps, and had to occassionally move aside for groups of seminary girls to pass through. Once we were on this path, the only way off would be to turn around, so we kept at it, and Safta did great even with her shoulder in the condition that it was.
mediaGroups.title: A Narrow Path

mediaGroups.description: On our first day in Israel, Safta described a difficult experience at the Kotel where somebody asked for charity, but after she gave to him, he kept asking for more and would not leave her be. And so it was especially nice that at the end of the trip Safta could come back with us and not have such an experience and instead be able to just be.
mediaGroups.title: Safta at the Kotel

mediaGroups.description: Moshe went with Sabba and Chaim to the men's side of the kotel, and after some tefilla, walked around the tunnel area again before meeting up with everybody in the main Kotel plaza area.
mediaGroups.title: At the Kotel

mediaGroups.description: Rifka, Nuriya, and Shira went to the Tisch Biblical Zoo
mediaGroups.title: Meanwhile at the zoo...

mediaGroups.description: Upon returning from the Kotel, Yair and Ben were in the lobby playing a game.
mediaGroups.title: Yair and Ben Gaming

mediaGroups.description: Rifka, Nuriya, and Shira stayed at the zoo as little while longer.  Not pictured, but Chaim went to Katzefet in Rechavia and had an ice cream cone and just walked around Rechavia, feeling sad that this is the last day of the trip, but also appreciative at how he could feel a such a connection to the land of Israel, and that he experienced these two weeks with his family.
mediaGroups.title: Still at the zoo

mediaEvents.title: Getting Ready to Leave, But One More Visit to the Kotel, and the Zoo!

mediaGroups.description: Just as Ben helped us with our bags and navigating, so too did he help us when it was time to leave.  And just like we feel like we could not have done it without him for arriving, so too, it would have been nearly impossible without his help because of the protests happening at the airport.  Ben schlepped suitcases, was our translator, and when we got to the airport and the police were closing off an entrance to block off the protesters, Ben explained to them about us being a family and not being able to easily walk to the other side of the airport and they let us through before closing off the entrance.
mediaGroups.title: To the Airport

mediaGroups.description: We were greeted by protesters. It made things interesting.
mediaGroups.title: The airport

mediaGroups.description: While there is a kosher McDonalds in Jerusalem, we did not partake of this novelty. But apparently there is also one in Ben Gurion Airport. And we did partake!  It was such an interesting contrast, where we were just in Jerusalem hours before, and here we are in the airport getting ready to leave Israel - yerida - and feeling pained about this. And then, there is this spicy McNugget at the airport, and it took the edge off this feeling, just a little bit.
mediaGroups.title: McDonalds

mediaGroups.description: We said our goodbyes to Ben and headed into the terminal to get ready to board the flight. Chaim stopped in the shul to daven maariv.
mediaGroups.title: The Terminal

mediaGroups.description: Safta ended up sitting next somebody who was part of the protest movement and apparently had nice conversations.
mediaGroups.title: The plane

mediaGroups.description: We landed in Newark at around 5:30am EST. As it turned out, one of our bags did not make it back, but was shipped to us a couple days later.
mediaGroups.title: Back In America

mediaGroups.description: We were all very tired, and yet grateful to have had such an experience - to be able to visit Israel and do so many wonderful things there.  Four months after our visit to Israel, Chaim would finally finish working on captioning this photo album and making a web application to publish it, to have these memories, and to remember to go back to Israel again.
mediaGroups.title: Newark Airport

2023-06-25-20-16-01-IMG_0089.description:
The trip started with heading to Sabba and Safta’s house on Sunday night, where we awaited the ride to the airport.

The flight was originally supposed to be at 1am, but was delayed to 5am.
2023-06-25-20-16-01-IMG_0089.title: To Sabba and Safta’s!

2023-06-25-22-07-58-IMG_0164.description: We spent some nice time at Sabba and Safta’s house, resting, eating, and repacking things. The driver arrived at around 11:30pm. We loaded our things and went to the airport!
2023-06-25-22-07-58-IMG_0164.title: Waiting for the Driver

2023-06-26-01-59-44-IMG_0185.description:
At first, the airport driver went to the wrong terminal. It was unusually quiet and we were told that there is a different terminal to go to. Once the driver found it, there was major traffic. We finally got there at 2am, 3 hours before our flight.

The airport was very busy. Apparently there was a Birthright flight scheduled for around the same time and there was limited airport staff at the late hour.

People in the airport seemed especially tense. We had to remember that regardless of where we were in the long lines, we would all get on the same plane at the same time!

Still, it would have been nice if the kids got to sit down, but everyone did great!

Note, the various close-up pictures are courtesy of Moshe who was given a new (old) iPhone shortly before the trip.
2023-06-26-01-59-44-IMG_0185.title: Arriving at JFK

2023-06-26-09-49-23-IMG_1211.description:
For some of us, this was our first plane ride in 10 years. For others, it was the first plane ride ever.

Some of us were nervous around take-off or landing, while others just sat back and enjoyed whatever was on the screen.

At this point we were all pretty tired and tried to sleep at various times throughout the flight.
2023-06-26-09-49-23-IMG_1211.title: The Plane

2023-06-26-15-35-52-IMG_1219.description:
And we arrived! Now very tired, but so so happy to be in Israel. It was around 11pm Israel time when we landed, and it took us a couple of hours to go through customs and get our baggage, mostly because kids would stop in awe of various new things - just being in the airport in Israel.

We actually had a small problem when exiting where Shira Ella’s entry card was missing after being handed back to me by somebody in the airport (maybe it fell when I put it back in my bag?). The airport staff wanted us to go back and have her take a new picture, but she was sleeping. Instead, and with some insistence, they called over various people who helped get her a new entry card so we could leave without having to wake her. We appreciated how they balanced the importance of airport security with not waking a sleeping child.
2023-06-26-15-35-52-IMG_1219.title: Arrival in Israel

2023-06-26-17-22-45-IMG_1224.description:
Our friend Ben came and met us at the airport, apparently waited for us as we took our time exiting the airport, and helped carry our suitcases and helped us to get on the train to the Jerusalem.

Everything was so smooth because of his help, to which we are so grateful for wonderful friends.

We took taxis for the last leg of the journey to the hotel where
2023-06-26-17-22-45-IMG_1224.title: Greeted by a Friend

2023-06-27-01-53-08-IMG_1061.description:
After a late night, not everyone wanted to get up. We had planned an itinerary that was supposed to include a “rest day” before touring, but forgot to count the “travel day”. Whoops.

Sabba, Safta, and Chaim got up and made it to the hotel breakfast, which was so plentiful and good, and something that we would continue to appreciate every day of this trip.
2023-06-27-01-53-08-IMG_1061.title: Breakfast at the Hotel

2023-06-27-03-04-16-IMG_5323.description:
We met our tour guide, Shimi, who was referred to us by our cousin Becky, at the hotel. He did an excellent job all around.

Upon leaving the hotel for Ir David, we saw police cars, which Shimi noted was to escort the Prime Minister somewhere, remarking on the irony of how not discreet it is to travel like that. As it turns out, our hotel was a few blocks away from the Prime Minister’s residence in Rechavia.
2023-06-27-03-04-16-IMG_5323.title: Leaving the Hotel

2023-06-27-03-25-34-IMG_1063.description: We headed to Ir David. While we were here before (10 years ago), we still learned new things about this area and everything that is being excavated. We also went through tunnels that were probably from the time of the Cana’anim.
2023-06-27-03-25-34-IMG_1063.title: Ir David

2023-06-27-04-27-16-IMG_0262.description: We exited the tunnels at the site of an olive tree that was hundreds of years old. We walked a little further to the kotel.
2023-06-27-04-27-16-IMG_0262.title: Olive Tree

2023-06-27-05-19-42-IMG_5330.description: We stopped at the kotel to pray at the site that Jews have been coming for two thousand years.
2023-06-27-05-19-42-IMG_5330.title: The Kotel

2023-06-27-06-36-24-IMG_5340.description: We walked through the Jewish Quarter and the Cardo. We eventually exited through the Arab Shuk, where Safta bought something for her friend back in America.
2023-06-27-06-36-24-IMG_5340.title: Cardo

2023-06-27-06-58-57-IMG_5528.description:
By now, on our first day in Israel, others were well rested enough to get up and do things. Some of us walked around the neighborhood and  found a windmill next to the hotel. Others hung out on Sabba and Safta’s balcony.

We eventually went to a playground down the road. Later, the kids played by the fountain in front of the hotel before going out for dinner at a cafe in Rechavia that Ben had showed Chaim earlier in the day.

We reflected on how amazing it is not only that we have this beautiful land of Israel to be in, but that there are flowers planted everywhere in the streets and parks and cafes and how people take such care of this precious land.
2023-06-27-06-58-57-IMG_5528.title: Late Afternoon in Rechavia

2023-06-27-13-48-06-IMG_0307.description: And concluding our first day in Israel with a walk to the ice cream place that was near the hotel. All in all a wonderful first full day in Israel!
2023-06-27-13-48-06-IMG_0307.title: Ice Cream in Rechavia

2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.description: We started the day at around 9am with tefilla and a wonderful breakfast. Shimi met us and the tour bus awaited.
2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.jpeg
2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.thumb.jpeg
2023-06-28-00-59-31-IMG_0309.title: Second Day, Our First Trip With All of Us

2023-06-28-01-58-35-IMG_0311.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-35-IMG_0311.jpeg
2023-06-28-01-58-35-IMG_0311.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-35-IMG_0311.thumb.jpeg

2023-06-28-01-58-40-IMG_0312.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-40-IMG_0312.jpeg
2023-06-28-01-58-40-IMG_0312.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-40-IMG_0312.thumb.jpeg

2023-06-28-01-58-41-IMG_0313.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-41-IMG_0313.jpeg
2023-06-28-01-58-41-IMG_0313.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-01-58-41-IMG_0313.thumb.jpeg

2023-06-28-03-00-32-IMG_0315.description: We traveled west to our first destination, a stalactite cave. Along the way, we saw all of the beautiful hills that surround Jerusalem.
2023-06-28-03-00-32-IMG_0315.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-03-00-32-IMG_0315.jpeg
2023-06-28-03-00-32-IMG_0315.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-03-00-32-IMG_0315.thumb.jpeg

2023-06-28-03-32-18-IMG_1228.description: We got to the stalactite cave area and walked down some stairs to go down the mountain. There was a small shop before the actual cave and neat to see how easily accessible this thousands-of-years-old wonder is, and yet how well-protected it is at the same time.

2023-06-28-04-26-12-IMG_0341.description:
We now went back up the stairs. Sadly, but memorably and ought to be mentioned here, this is when Safta fell. Yair had remarked that some of the steps leading up the mountain were especially smooth, and seemingly Safta stepped on one of them and fell, fracturing her shoulder. To make matters more difficult, this was just moments before Sabba and Safta were about to head off to Mitzpe Ramon to spend two nights there.

Safta resolved to continue up the steps and to still go to Mitzpe Ramon and take it moment by moment, instead of focussing on the hurt shoulder. There was a taxi next to the tour bus awaiting to take them there, and so we all walked up together and Sabba and Safta went to their taxi and we to our tour bus.

2023-06-28-05-12-17-IMG_0350.description:
The next stop was the bat cave. This involved a hike up another mountain that was a short bus ride away. This time there were no steps or gift shops along the way. And it was getting very hot.

Everybody did amazing on the ~3km hike to the cave. There were some slippery rock to climb up, but kids of all ages managed with only a little help at times.

We stopped at almost every shady spot along the way, and there were beautiful trees all around, including olive and (possibly) carob trees.

2023-06-28-06-01-03-IMG_0142.description:
We got to the actual bat cave. Now, not everybody wanted to go in. Shimi the tour guide went ahead with Moshe and Nuriya. Chaim went in with Eshka, although every time it seemed like a bat was coming to us, Eshka screamed and we ran out together. Rifka, Yair, and Shira hung out outside the bat cave.

As Eshka and Chaim inched our way further and further in, and tried talking calmly to the bats (which they seemed responsive too), they noticed that Moshe and Nuriya went with Shimi all the way to the end of the cave (at least where people can walk)! They slowly went forward and eventually met up with them as they were on their way back.

Soon after that, a large group of yeshiva kids came in with flashlights. It suddenly was not as scary, although Chaim pondered if the bats were now more scared of us. We learned that the batcave is only open the public during certain months to give the bats a break.

Most of these pictures are blurry as it was very dark in the bat cave.

2023-06-28-10-03-55-IMG_0488.description: On the way out, we noticed that the gift shop sells kosher locusts with an amusing sign.
2023-06-28-10-03-55-IMG_0488.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-10-03-55-IMG_0488.jpeg

2023-06-28-10-03-55-IMG_0488.title: Locusts in the Gift Shop

2023-06-28-10-07-15-IMG_1238.description:
The following pictures are from Sabba and Safta’s visit to Miztpe Ramon. Safta said about her hurt shoulder that there is nothing that she can do about it, so she might as well just appreciate every moment of being in this beautiful place.

It also happened that Sabba left his camera in the taxi (which we got back the following week), so there are not many pictures. But, here they are, starting with, apparently, a picture of a McDonalds that was on the way there?
2023-06-28-10-07-15-IMG_1238.title: Sabba and Safta in Mitzpe Ramon

2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.description: After a day of adventure, we arrived back at the hotel at around 5:45pm for a quick recharge.
2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.jpeg
2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Stalagmites, Batcave, Rockslide, Spring, and Biblical Natural History Museum/2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.thumb.jpeg
2023-06-28-10-43-18-IMG_0490.title: Back at the Hotel

2023-06-28-11-38-29-IMG_0491.description: Moshe, Eshka, and Abba ventured out to Ben Yehuda Street at around 6:40pm. They stopped on the way there at a grocery store to get Israeli Kinder Eggs and chocolate to bring back.
2023-06-28-11-38-29-IMG_0491.title: Recharged and Ready to Explore

2023-06-28-12-54-26-70966406631__BBA5519.description: And then Pizza Hut. Being able to eat almost anywhere or even eating in a restaurant (fast food) place was a new and exciting experience for everybody. While we have several kosher amenities back in West Hartford, there is something amazing about being able to walk into a Pizza Hut and order a kosher slice of pizza.
2023-06-28-12-54-26-70966406631__BBA5519.title: Pizza Hut

2023-06-28-13-07-13-IMG_0495.description: The streets are filled with beautiful decorations.
2023-06-28-13-07-13-IMG_0495.title: Walking Back

2023-06-28-17-06-55-IMG_0498.description:
Later that night, after the kids went to sleep, Chaim took a walk to the Old City to visit the kotel again and daven maariv. On the way back, he stopped by the menorah outside the Hurva shul in the Jewish Quarter and took some selfies next to it and a cat.

Some fascinating info about the golden menorah can be found here: https://templeinstitute.org/history-holy-temple-menorah/

Chaim took a bus back, so he could figure out how to use buses in Jerusalem to be prepared for the next day’s adventure. He got on a bus, but did not have a Rav Kav card and was unable to setup the Moovit app, but the driver literally just gave him a Rav Kav card with money already on it. He tried to refuse, but the driver insisted.
2023-06-28-17-06-55-IMG_0498.title: Chaim in the Old City

2023-06-29-05-21-00-IMG_5557.description:
For the rest of the crew, it was a new morning in Jerusalem and we had a late start with no official tours scheduled. Instead, the plan for the day was to find the famous “Monster Slide” that we vaguely remember going to 10 years ago, although possibly confused with a video of watching Jason and Jen at that very slide back in 1978.

The early afternoon started with running into a friend on the street!
2023-06-29-05-21-00-IMG_5557.title: Meanwhile…

2023-06-29-07-31-57-IMG_0507.description: Some excitement about taking a city bus in Jerusalem
2023-06-29-07-31-57-IMG_0507.title: Bus ride to the slide

2023-06-29-07-54-10-IMG_0513.description:
And here we are at the Monster Slide. As noted above, this was the same slide that Sabba and Safta went to with Jason and Jenn, back in 1978. In fact, here is a link to a video of that, in the part that shows them there: https://youtu.be/GgLQchcvP7M?t=1192

While Sabba and Safta were in Mitzpe Ramon this time around, and missed this visit to the Monster Slide, it seems like that at least experienced it back in 1978.
2023-06-29-07-54-10-IMG_0513.title: The Monster Slide

2023-06-29-10-47-50-IMG_0523.description:
Next, we went to Ben Yehuda Street for lunch. Yair wanted to stay back to the hotel, so we dropped him off, since we inadvertently ended up taking a bus stop that was adjacent to the hotel anyway. After that, Chaim wanted to lead everyone else on a trip through the Mamilla Mall and to the Kotel, stopping for food along the way.

Unfortunately, Chaim was still getting his sense of direction in Jerusalem and didn’t look at Google Maps, so we ended up walking in circles, but was really nice passing by everything that was going on. Eventually the kids were hungry, so we stopped at Pasta Basta and brought lunch back for Yair.
2023-06-29-10-47-50-IMG_0523.title: Pasta Basta

2023-06-29-12-58-27-IMG_0524.description: Towards the end of a less trip-focused, more grounded third day in Jerusalem, some decided to stay in and enjoy the Kinder Eggs from the previous evening.
2023-06-29-12-58-27-IMG_0524.title: Staying In

2023-06-29-15-24-03-IMG_0527.description: Moshe however decided that he wants to work on his Scratch project, to which Abba said that he should do it in some public internet place that is “out”. And so Abba and Moshe ventured to Ben Yehuda to find public internet. They stopped at Big Apple Pizza and ate, but alas no internet there. So, they found a spot outside on the busy streets.
2023-06-29-15-24-03-IMG_0527.title: Venturing Out

2023-06-29-16-13-46-IMG_0539.description: Moshe enjoyed climbing on the various things along the streets. Wherever we would walk, he found find ledges and such to walk along.
2023-06-29-16-13-46-IMG_0539.title: Climbing

2023-06-29-17-17-58-IMG_0542.description: After the kids were settled, Chaim went back out to go daven Ma’ariv at the kotel again. And again he got a little lost, but this time built up his mental map of Jerusalem and where different streets lead and converge. And so, on the way there, he past by the Montefiore Windmill, which is technically not on the way.
2023-06-29-17-17-58-IMG_0542.title: Chaim’s Second Night Roam

2023-06-29-17-43-00-IMG_0544.description: Upon reaching the kotel at 12:45am, there was a large group singing and dancing. Chaim spent some time there and then went back to the hotel to rest up for the next day of activity and Erev Shabbat in Jerusalem.
2023-06-29-17-43-00-IMG_0544.title: The Kotel at 12:45am

2023-06-30-02-37-52-IMG_0546.description: The day started with another wonderful breakfast and then Abba and Shira went to the playground.
2023-06-30-02-37-52-IMG_0546.title: Friday Morning in Jerusalem

2023-06-30-06-28-36-IMG_0552.description: After everybody got ready, we ventured out to the Botanical Gardens in Jerusalem. We walked there and had some trouble finding the entrance with a stroller, due to some nearby construction, but once we found it, the kids stopped to rest.
2023-06-30-06-28-36-IMG_0552.title: To the Botanical Gardens

2023-06-30-07-31-51-IMG_5580.description: Before actually going into the garden, we stopped for lunch at a nearby cafe, noting that things were closing early for Shabbat and that the kids were getting hungry.
2023-06-30-07-31-51-IMG_5580.title: Quick Stop for Lunch

2023-06-30-07-47-30-IMG_1271.description: They stopped at Terem to look at Safta’s shoulder. It turned out it was fractured after an x-ray. They gave Safta a sling and some instructions to come back in a week.
2023-06-30-07-47-30-IMG_1271.title: Meanwhile, Sabba and Safta were Arriving Back in Jerusalem

2023-06-30-07-54-41-IMG_0423.description: We were now ready to enter the garden, but first stopping to look at the lily pads and a frog.
2023-06-30-07-54-41-IMG_0423.title: The Lily Pads

2023-06-30-08-31-36-IMG_5595.description: The kids did bowling with a pine cone.
2023-06-30-08-31-36-IMG_5595.title: Pine Cone Bowling

2023-06-30-09-06-08-IMG_0574.description: We took the bus back to the hotel, since everyone was tired and Abba did not want to push the stroller up hill.
2023-06-30-09-06-08-IMG_0574.title: Taking the Bus Back

2023-06-30-09-49-56-IMG_0580.description: We took a break at the fountain outside the hotel before going in.
2023-06-30-09-49-56-IMG_0580.title: Back at the Hotel

2023-06-30-09-57-13-IMG_0586.description:
We arrived back to get ready for Shabbat and were greeted by Sabba and Safta who were getting ready as well.

We do not have pictures of course, but Shabbat in the hotel with all of us together was such a wonderful experience. The food was really good, but it just felt so special to be in Jerusalem together around the table making kiddush and in room with so many families and groups doing the same.

On Friday night after the meal, some of us walked to the Old City to try to visit Binyonim Sheis and then to the kotel. We could not find where Binyonim was staying, but proceeded on to the kotel, which was the first time for Nuriya and Shira, and the first time this visit for Rifka, Eshka, and Moshe.

As we learned, the Old City is not easy to get around with a stroller, but some yeshiva bachorim helped with at least one set of stairs.

We had a wonderful Friday night at the kotel.

Afterwards, Chaim went to visit Ben at Sora’s apartment and they played games up 4:30am.

The next morning, some of us slept in a little, still getting over jet lag and catching up on sleep, but we all eventually made it to daven at our various paces and then to do kiddush at around 2pm. Again, the food was wonderful and so great being all together.

Later in the afternoon, Chaim, Rifka, and Eshka headed off to visit the Rothman’s in Nachlaot. They went up the seven flights of stairs to their apartment and hung out with them on the room of their building eating watermelon and having meaningful conversation.

Afterwards, some of us went to visit Ben to play games, and by the end of Shabbat, Chaim, Rifka, Yair, Moshe, and Eshka were all at Sora’s apartment hanging out, and we made havdallah there, led by Sora’s father, while Sabba, Safta, Nuriya, and Shira hung out at the hotel.
2023-06-30-09-57-13-IMG_0586.title: Sabba and Safta are Back and Shabbat is Coming

2023-07-01-15-28-30-IMG_1110.description: Happening in the backdrop of our trip to Israel were protests about the Judicial Reform. Being that our hotel was in Rechavia, just a couple blocks away from the Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s residence, and being at a major intersection, it was apparently also a hot spot for political activism. As such, there were protests on the street right outside the hotel, near the fountain. And so was the start of our second week in Israel.
2023-07-01-15-28-30-IMG_1110.title: Protests

2023-07-02-03-11-00-IMG_0591.description: Sabba and Safta get an early start and then venture out to the Jerusale Great Synagogue, which was right next to the hotel.
2023-07-02-03-11-00-IMG_0591.title: Sunday Morning

2023-07-02-06-11-41-IMG_0592.description: It was Sunday morning. We had a few options on the schedule for today, and Rifka and Chaim decided that we would walk to First Station, where they would surprise Yair for his birthday. Not pictured here is Rifka and Chaim’s walk to a bakery to obtain that cake, as well as a blue hat for Safta.
2023-07-02-06-11-41-IMG_0592.title: Yom Rishon

2023-07-02-06-31-28-IMG_0541.description: We stopped at the Montefiore Windmill on the way, as well as a Shalhevet Etsioni, where Shira found an interesting snail shell and we listened to a recording about the memorial.
2023-07-02-06-31-28-IMG_0541.title: IMG_0541.JPG

2023-07-02-06-46-13-IMG_0557.description: We then stopped at the Lion fountain, and some of us went in it.
2023-07-02-06-46-13-IMG_0557.title: The Lion Fountain

2023-07-02-07-16-25-IMG_0631.description:
And then we went to First Station. We were here 10 years ago (not all of us), and there seemed to be more things. For example, there was an old train car that Yair and Moshe (and possibly Eshka) played around 10 years ago. That was upgraded and now you can go in it and there is a whole miniature city connected by train tracks and model trains in it. There also seemed to be some new (well not new, but newly placed) amusement rides. We had burgers and (surprise!) birthday cake, and the kids went on various rides. We also shopped in the little gift shops and there were some interestingly translated items.

We also went to two places that we remember from 10 years ago that were still there: The puzzle store, where we purchased some wooden puzzles, and Rebar, the juice bar.
2023-07-02-07-16-25-IMG_0631.title: First Station

2023-07-02-09-26-35-IMG_0656.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Gan Sacher, Meet Abby Family and Aliza and Family/2023-07-02-09-26-35-IMG_0656.jpeg
2023-07-02-09-26-35-IMG_0656.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Gan Sacher, Meet Abby Family and Aliza and Family/2023-07-02-09-26-35-IMG_0656.thumb.jpeg

2023-07-02-10-04-21-IMG_0661.description: After coming back from First Station, some of the kids checked out their new puzzles in the lobby, for quick recharge before heading back out to Gan Sacher.
2023-07-02-10-04-21-IMG_0661.title: Back at the Hotel

2023-07-02-10-34-11-IMG_0665.description: After a short regrouping back at the hotel, the next stop was Gan Sacher. Rifka made plans to meet Aliza and her children, of who we remember from 10 years ago when we stayed in Katamon and the kids used to climb through the windows into their adjoining apartment.  Eshka was not feeling great, so she went with Rifka in a taxi, while others walked through Rechavia and to the park.
2023-07-02-10-34-11-IMG_0665.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Gan Sacher, Meet Abby Family and Aliza and Family/2023-07-02-10-34-11-IMG_0665.jpeg

2023-07-02-10-34-11-IMG_0665.title: Going to Gan Sacher

2023-07-02-12-23-06-IMG_0734.description: Here we are with Aliza and her children. We also met up with Abby and her family, which was a wonderful surprise that the timing could work out. We do not seem to have any pictures of that reunion though.

2023-07-02-13-25-31-IMG_0737.description: Special for Yair's birthday, after Gan Sacher, Ben met us to take Yair to a game store in Ben Yehuda Street area. Unfortunately the store that he had in mind was not open, but Yair was able to look around at a book store that also had games.
2023-07-02-13-25-31-IMG_0737.title: A bookstore with games

2023-07-02-14-42-43-IMG_1292.description: After checking out games, Ben, Chaim, and Yair stopped at the hotel and picked up Sabba and Moshe and we headed to the movies!  This would be Chaim's second time going to the movies in Israel - the first about 20 years ago to watch Spiderman 2. And here we saw Across the Spiderverse.  This would be second or even third viewing for some of us, but this spectacular movie was only made better by the fact that we were in Jerusalem experiencing it. It was a special evening indeed.
2023-07-02-14-42-43-IMG_1292.title: Across the Spiderverse

2023-07-03-03-57-25-29A0CE88-4E17-4990-B.description: After a late night at the movies, we got up early and Shimi met us for our next adventure - to head in the direction of Tel Aviv.  Shimi scheduled with the Galita Cholocate Factory, and so that was our first stop.  Pictured here was a picture that we took on the bus, while we were all a little tired, but to send to our cousin Judy Porat, whom we were making plans with for another day.
2023-07-03-03-57-25-29A0CE88-4E17-4990-B.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Galita Chololate Factory, Anu Museum, Tel Aviv Beach with Cousins, and Hanging out with the Weinstocks/2023-07-03-03-57-25-29A0CE88-4E17-4990-BB54-62950515BA86.jpeg

2023-07-03-07-16-59-IMG_0769.description: The Anu Museum is on the campus of Tel Aviv University. While there, the kids found a tree that is apparently common in Israel. They took with them some of the large "beans" that grow from it, that look almost like a large carob. These would later end up in one of our suitcases, which would end up not coming back with us from Israel, probably due to the "sword-like beans" in it.

2023-07-03-10-53-48-IMG_1313.description: Next we went to the beach, where we met our cousins Marla and Becky Arbiv.  Shimi, our tour guide, was recommended to us as a friend of Becky, whom Chaim had only met virtually months before our trip and learned that she is in the same industry - biotechnology - and actually has had meetings with his company - 10X Genomics. Of course, we arranged to meet when in Israel and it worked out that Becky's mother, Marla - that is Sabba's niece, was there at the same time.
