2023-07-03-15-28-46-5930e9db-c910-4f18-8.description: Our next step for some would be the Weinstock’s (Natalie’s) parents house where they were staying. Sabba, Safta, and Yair decided to go back to the hotel and the tour bus took them the rest of the way. The rest of us hung out with the Weinstock's and the kids watched a movie outside, while the adults talked and had hotdogs. It was particularly grounding after such a packed day of so much wonderful activity.

2023-07-04-01-55-55-IMG_0934.description: This was to be last of our major travel/touring days for this visit to Israel, and would involve the most time/distance spent going places. It was a very hot day and we headed along the Jordon River to go North towards Afula. Shimi met us in the morning and we boarded the bus and were on our way!

2023-07-04-01-59-39-IMG_0827.description: While sitting on the bus, Nuriya wondered aloud “Will we ride on camels?” What good timing to ask, as Shimi told the driver to please pull over at the next place where there are camels and that happened to be very shortly up the road.  While Nuriya did not actually go on a camel, Moshe, Eshka, and Rifka did.  Rifka also got a necklace, as a gift from Sabba and Safta.

2023-07-04-03-43-19-IMG_0909.description: We continued through the desert with Shimi talking about the places that we passed. We had a quick stop at a cafe (and tefillin for those had not yet!) and then to our next stop - Gan Garoo Zoo.

2023-07-04-04-25-31-IMG_5374.description: It was very hot and everyone was feeling it, but we were still excited to be at the zoo and to see some really interesting animals. Apparently this zoo has animals that are from Austraila.
2023-07-04-04-25-31-IMG_5374.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Camel Rides, Gan Ganroo, Gan HaShalosha, and Kineret Water Park/2023-07-04-04-25-31-IMG_5374.jpeg

2023-07-04-08-52-30-IMG_1032.description: The original plan was to go on a boat ride on the Kineret. On the way there, Moshe saw a giant water slide and asked if we could do that instead. Shimi, ever resourceful, made a quick call and we ended up going to the water park!  Yair, Safta, and Shimi did not go and ended up hanging out nearby, but the rest of us went to the water park and went on various water slides by the Kineret.

2023-07-04-17-40-20-IMG_5644.description: Later that evening, Rifka and Chaim ventured out to Ben Yehuda area.
2023-07-04-17-40-20-IMG_5644.title: Date Night

2023-07-04-17-52-20-IMG_1080.description: We found a bar in Ben Yehuda area that had live American music and a Playstation where we played Mortal Kombat
2023-07-04-17-52-20-IMG_1080.title: Blaze Rock Bar

2023-07-05-01-52-44-IMG_1084.description: For the rest of the trip, we did not have any more planned tours, but did have a number of things that we wanted to see or do. One such thing, at least for some of us, was to go to the Dead Sea.  And so we started planning that the next morning, but first Tefilla!  In this picture, Shira joined Chaim in the hotel's synagouge. Afterwards, we would make plans and some of us would go to the Dead Sea.
2023-07-05-01-52-44-IMG_1084.title: Wednesday Morning

2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.description: While Sabba, Chaim, and Moshe were at the Dead Sea, others hung out in Jerusalem.
2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Meanwhile in Jerusalem, Dinner in Ben Yehuda, and the Game Store is Closed/2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.jpeg
2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Meanwhile in Jerusalem, Dinner in Ben Yehuda, and the Game Store is Closed/2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.thumb.jpeg
2023-07-05-03-39-27-IMG_5650.title: Meanwhile in Jerusalem

2023-07-05-05-55-22-IMG_1091.description: When we told Moshe that there is a Pizza Hut in the bus station, he decided to come with us to the Dead Sea, which he was otherwise seemingly ambivelent about.  The novelty of kosher pizza was greater than the novelty of a wonder of the world.
2023-07-05-05-55-22-IMG_1091.title: Stop at Pizza Hut

2023-07-05-07-19-12-IMG_1363.description: The bus dropped us off in what was basically "the middle of the desert", really a short walk from the actual beach, but if not for the signs, it would look like there was desert hills all around. Eventually, somebody in a shuttle came and picked us up, but would have probably been about a 15 minute walk otherwise.
2023-07-05-07-19-12-IMG_1363.title: To Kalia Beach

2023-07-05-08-48-13-1997B6F7-8E47-46B7-B.description: Yair got to play Race to the Galaxy with Ben in the hotel lobby
2023-07-05-08-48-13-1997B6F7-8E47-46B7-B.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Meanwhile in Jerusalem, Dinner in Ben Yehuda, and the Game Store is Closed/2023-07-05-08-48-13-1997B6F7-8E47-46B7-BBF7-E4877438CAC8.jpeg

2023-07-05-08-48-13-1997B6F7-8E47-46B7-B.title: Race to the Galaxy with Ben

2023-07-05-10-11-51-IMG_1132.description: After our Dead Sea experience, we awaited the bus back to Jerusalem. Again, it was an interesting feeling with desert all around.
2023-07-05-10-11-51-IMG_1132.title: Awaiting the Bus Back

2023-07-05-11-58-03-IMG_1307.description: Moshe got this camel for Shira at the gift shop by the Dead Sea. He would later notice that this same (or similar) camel is sold in many other places. But, this one was special.
2023-07-05-11-58-03-IMG_1307.title: Camel

2023-07-05-13-23-36-IMG_1157.description: While Rifka and Yair were in the Old City, Sabba, Chaim, and Moshe got back from the Dead Sea. Later, Sabba and Safta went out for dinner, and Chaim decided to bring Nuriya and Shira to meet them there.  The next several pictures are in chronological order, but of two separate events in different parts of Jerusalem.

2023-07-05-16-06-54-IMG_1167.description: Later on Wednesday night, there was a big protest outside the hotel. Here are some of the pictures of it.
2023-07-05-16-06-54-IMG_1167.title: Protests Against Judicial Reform

2023-07-06-06-54-49-IMG_5670.description: It was the morning of the 17th of Tammuz, a fast day.  We were trying to decide what we should do today that would be meaningful, and discussing if it would be wise to do anything, since it was very hot and easy to get dehydrated. After some deliberation (and I think a walk to drop of our laundry, if I remember correctly), we decided to go to First Station again.
2023-07-06-06-54-49-IMG_5670.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/17 Tammuz, First Station, and Around Old City and Kotel/2023-07-06-06-54-49-IMG_5670.jpeg

2023-07-06-06-54-49-IMG_5670.title: 17 Tammuz

2023-07-06-09-33-10-IMG_1309.description: We went back to the puzzle store at First Station that we went to 10 years ago. The kids picked out puzzles, including a tanagrams set, and played them outside. Shira slept in the stroller.

2023-07-06-09-56-35-IMG_1189.description: Chaim wanted to go to the Old City for the remainder of the fast day, already starting to feel dehydrated, but just wanted to settle somewhere in the Old City by the Kotel.  On the way there, Chaim found a small section of Jerusalem called Mishkenot She'enim, where there was a plaque that talked about Avraham Michael Kirshenbaum, who "stood alone defending Yemin Moshe against the enemy". Chaim found this area, just outside the Old City, to be particularly special and meaningful on 17 Tammuz, reflecting on everything that came before to be able to stand in this spot today, and spent some time there before heading to the Old City, walking through Yemin Moshe.
2023-07-06-09-56-35-IMG_1189.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/17 Tammuz, First Station, and Around Old City and Kotel/2023-07-06-09-56-35-IMG_1189.jpeg

2023-07-06-11-31-42-IMG_1209.description: It was getting late in the day and some people at the Kotel were starting to daven maariv, while others were putting on tefillin.

2023-07-06-11-37-25-IMG_1379.description: In the meantime, Sabba and Safta went to Terem for Safta's arm to get checked out. B"H, she was told it was healing well and might start to feel better in "3 weeks". Of course 17 Tammuz is the start of "three weeks".
2023-07-06-11-37-25-IMG_1379.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/17 Tammuz, First Station, and Around Old City and Kotel/2023-07-06-11-37-25-IMG_1379.jpeg

2023-07-06-11-37-25-IMG_1379.title: Terem

2023-07-06-11-58-56-71035193615__E894F94.description: By now, Chaim was feeling very tired, but still got to be part of a very moving mincha service in the Kotel arch tunnel area.  After that, Chaim took a taxi back and arrived back just before the end of the fast.

2023-07-07-02-39-50-IMG_1380.description: It was a new day and we had made plans to visit our cousins the Sylveski's at a pizza place in Emek Refaim
2023-07-07-02-39-50-IMG_1380.title: Friday Morning Breakfast

2023-07-07-04-57-41-IMG_5679.description: But first, Rifka and Chaim went to get ice cream at the nearby Katsefet
2023-07-07-04-57-41-IMG_5679.title: Ice Cream

2023-07-07-05-36-58-IMG_1222.description: On the way to the pizza place, Chaim needed to stop at a SuperPharm to pick something up for his stomach, which was not feeling great. When there, he got to do a special mitzvah to help somebody. It was especially nice to be at the right place at the right time, something that was particularly palpable throughout our time in Israel.
2023-07-07-05-36-58-IMG_1222.title: To Emek Refaim

2023-07-07-06-52-05-IMG_5682.description: Yair got Sushi from a nearby place
2023-07-07-06-52-05-IMG_5682.title: Sushi

2023-07-07-07-01-57-IMG_1144.description: We all got to hang out with Elaine and Teddy Sylvesky
2023-07-07-07-01-57-IMG_1144.title: The Sylvesky's

2023-07-07-09-05-51-IMG_1229.description: It was nearly Shabbat, but we needed to pick up the laundry.
2023-07-07-09-05-51-IMG_1229.title: Back at the Hotel

2023-07-07-09-40-51-IMG_1230.description: The laundry place was closed. Yair would end up taking a special trip with Sabba to pick up a new Shabbat shirt at the one store that they could find that was still open.
2023-07-07-09-40-51-IMG_1230.title: No Laundry

2023-07-07-10-18-59-IMG_1232.description: We found a particularly interesting brand of kosher wine. Of course, there are no pictures from Shabbat, but we had guests: The Weinstock family came to share Shabbat meals with us in the hotel, staying at a nearby hotel, and so did Ben.  We had a very lively and wonderful Shabbat meal. There was so much joy of us all being together, and so much interesting discussion.  On Shabbat day, Chaim still had an upset stomache from the day before, and so he stayed in the hotel for much of the day, but still had really nice get-togethers. Others went to a playground. And others played games.  Near the end of Shabbat, Chaim was starting to feel better, and there were really nice interactions with all of the kids and families and friends.
2023-07-07-10-18-59-IMG_1232.title: Shabbat Preparation

2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.description: The kids wanted to play card games with Ben. I said, let's go to the Rova - in the Old City - and play games there. And so we headed out, stopping in Ben Yehuda area, and eventually taking a taxi to the Old City.
2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Motzei Shabbat Games in the Rova and Beyond/2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.mov
2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.thumbnailSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Motzei Shabbat Games in the Rova and Beyond/2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.thumb.jpeg
2023-07-08-14-36-25-IMG_1233.title: Motzei Shabbat

2023-07-08-15-33-03-IMG_5690.description: While we were going to the Old City, Sabba and Safta captured more protests happening outside the hotel, as was apparently the normal Motzei Shabbat activity during that political climate.

2023-07-09-02-40-53-IMG_1387.description: It was Sunday morning, a new week, and we came down for the hotel breakfast as we did every day. This would be our last few days of this trip to Israel. Still with some things that we had on our list to see and do, we put together a plan for the day's adventures.  It would be to (finally) take Yair to the Game Store where he can pick out some games for his birthday, go to the Shuk with Sabba and Safta, and visit the Noimans in Gilo

2023-07-09-06-07-08-IMG_5692.description: Chaim was feeling particularly concerned about timing of everything and so we made haste to get to the Shuk, where we would meet Sabba, Safta, Eshka, and Moshe. 2023-07-09-12-50-28-IMG_5700.description: Rifka and Chaim snuck out of the hotel to go on a date, unbeknownst that Sabba and Safta were also out at that time.  They first went to look for a certain Chabad shul to daven mincha, and when they could not find it, ended up going to what they thought was a Breslov shul, but turned out to be next to a Breslov shul.  With the timing of everything, they headed to Ben Yehuda next, only to bump into Sabba and Safta who were also walking around that area.
2023-07-09-12-50-28-IMG_5700.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Second Date Night and Bump into Sabba and Safta Who Are Also Out/2023-07-09-12-50-28-IMG_5700.jpeg

2023-07-10-02-18-29-IMG_1364.description: It was the second-to-last day of this trip and we had a relaxing morning in the hotel. Rifka and Chaim would eventually head out for a third date on this trip! And then a visit to our cousins, the Porats in Beerot Yitzchak.
2023-07-10-02-18-29-IMG_1364.title: Monday Morning

2023-07-10-05-12-37-IMG_1379.description: Rifka and Chaim went to Mishkenot She'enim, followed by the ceramic art place, the places that Chaim went to on 17 Tammuz
2023-07-10-05-12-37-IMG_1379.title: Mishkenot She'enim Again

2023-07-10-06-47-20-IMG_1396.description: Rifka made the Kineret and Chaim made a lion
2023-07-10-06-47-20-IMG_1396.title: The Kineret and a Lion

2023-07-10-07-53-22-IMG_1404.description: Rifka and Chaim have fast food on Jaffa Street. It turns out that there are (at least) two "King of Fries"
2023-07-10-07-53-22-IMG_1404.title: King of Fries and Shnitzel

2023-07-10-08-26-35-IMG_1407.description: Rifka and Chaim ran back to drop off their art and head out with the family to visit the Porats in Beerot Yitzchak
2023-07-10-08-26-35-IMG_1407.title: Running Back

2023-07-10-09-33-46-IMG_1400.description: We went to the central bus station and got on the bus to Petach Tikva. Unlike when heading north along the East side of Israel, which is mostly desert, the landscape to the West was very green and with much scenic forest all around.  Our cousins would meet us at the Kibbutz.

2023-07-10-18-48-02-IMG_1494.description: Standing in this kotel tunnel and reflecting on how there are layers upon layers of history of Jewish lives and societies that were all here at some point.  It is hard to tell from the picture, but it is long way down beneath that glass.

2023-07-11-02-10-33-IMG_1496.description: Tefilla, Breakfast, and Yair working on a game in the hotel lobby.  We are so comfortable here and sad to be leaving, but there is much packing to do, so after an early start, we pack!

2023-07-11-04-39-01-IMG_5731.description: By around noon, we had finished packing and everything was in the lobby. Our flight was in about 12 hours. Although, we were told that we need to get to the airport extra early because there were expected protests that could block traffic.  Still, we had about 6 more hours in Jerusalem, so...

2023-07-11-06-56-49-IMG_1351.description: Sabba, Safta, Chaim, Moshe, and Eshka went to visit the kotel, while Rifka, Nuria, and Shira went to the Tisch Biblical Zoo, and Yair stayed at the hotel to work on his game and eventually meet Ben to play games in the lobby.  It is amazing how after just two weeks, we all felt so comfortable to just do different things, mere hours before we would need to be heading to the airport.

2023-07-11-07-07-46-IMG_1439.description: We took a taxi to the Jewish Quarter, although he didn't take us directly to the Kotel (in retrospect, it would have been good to be more specific). Safta's shoulder was still in a sling and she was trying to regain balance, which makes it particularly ironic that we ended up walking along a narrow path with steep steps, and had to occassionally move aside for groups of seminary girls to pass through. Once we were on this path, the only way off would be to turn around, so we kept at it, and Safta did great even with her shoulder in the condition that it was.
2023-07-11-07-07-46-IMG_1439.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Getting Ready to Leave, But One More Visit to the Kotel, and the Zoo!/2023-07-11-07-07-46-IMG_1439.jpeg

2023-07-11-07-26-54-IMG_1175.description: On our first day in Israel, Safta described a difficult experience at the Kotel where somebody asked for charity, but after she gave to him, he kept asking for more and would not leave her be. And so it was especially nice that at the end of the trip Safta could come back with us and not have such an experience and instead be able to just be.
2023-07-11-07-26-54-IMG_1175.fullSrc: https://jeffpeck-media.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/israel-2023/Getting Ready to Leave, But One More Visit to the Kotel, and the Zoo!/2023-07-11-07-26-54-IMG_1175.jpeg

2023-07-11-08-39-01-IMG_5735.description: Rifka, Nuriya, and Shira stayed at the zoo as little while longer.  Not pictured, but Chaim went to Katzefet in Rechavia and had an ice cream cone and just walked around Rechavia, feeling sad that this is the last day of the trip, but also appreciative at how he could feel a such a connection to the land of Israel, and that he experienced these two weeks with his family.

2023-07-11-11-15-31-IMG_1630.description: Just as Ben helped us with our bags and navigating, so too did he help us when it was time to leave.  And just like we feel like we could not have done it without him for arriving, so too, it would have been nearly impossible without his help because of the protests happening at the airport.  Ben schlepped suitcases, was our translator, and when we got to the airport and the police were closing off an entrance to block off the protesters, Ben explained to them about us being a family and not being able to easily walk to the other side of the airport and they let us through before closing off the entrance.
2023-07-11-11-15-31-IMG_1630.title: To the Airport

2023-07-11-12-39-10-IMG_1455.description: We were greeted by protesters. It made things interesting.
2023-07-11-12-39-10-IMG_1455.title: The airport

2023-07-11-13-51-58-IMG_1377.description: While there is a kosher McDonalds in Jerusalem, we did not partake of this novelty. But apparently there is also one in Ben Gurion Airport. And we did partake!  It was such an interesting contrast, where we were just in Jerusalem hours before, and here we are in the airport getting ready to leave Israel - yerida - and feeling pained about this. And then, there is this spicy McNugget at the airport, and it took the edge off this feeling, just a little bit.
2023-07-11-13-51-58-IMG_1377.title: McDonalds

2023-07-11-16-57-43-IMG_1459.description: We said our goodbyes to Ben and headed into the terminal to get ready to board the flight. Chaim stopped in the shul to daven maariv.
2023-07-11-16-57-43-IMG_1459.title: The Terminal

2023-07-11-17-51-48-IMG_1717.description: Safta ended up sitting next somebody who was part of the protest movement and apparently had nice conversations.
2023-07-11-17-51-48-IMG_1717.title: The plane

2023-07-12-05-49-39-IMG_1461.description: We landed in Newark at around 5:30am EST. As it turned out, one of our bags did not make it back, but was shipped to us a couple days later.
2023-07-12-05-49-39-IMG_1461.title: Back In America

2023-07-12-06-13-40-IMG_1406.description: We were all very tired, and yet grateful to have had such an experience - to be able to visit Israel and do so many wonderful things there.  Four months after our visit to Israel, Chaim would finally finish working on captioning this photo album and making a web application to publish it, to have these memories, and to remember to go back to Israel again.
2023-07-12-06-13-40-IMG_1406.title: Newark Airport
